members.member:
Retrieves a transaction given a transaction hash in either simple or verbose form.
The transaction hash. True if verbose model wanted. The hash of the block in which to look for the transaction. A or as specified by verbose. null if no transaction matching the hash. Thrown if txid is invalid uint256." When called with a blockhash argument, getrawtransaction will return the transaction if the specified block is available and the transaction is found in that block. When called without a blockhash argument, getrawtransaction will return the transaction if it is in the mempool, or if -txindex is enabled and the transaction is in a block in the blockchain.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.Controllers.FullNodeController.DecodeRawTransaction(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a transaction from its raw hexadecimal format.
member.returns: A or null if the transaction could not be decoded.

members.member:
Implements gettextout RPC call.
The transaction id. The vout number. Whether to include the mempool. A containing the unspent outputs of the transaction id and vout. null if unspent outputs not found. Thrown if txid is invalid."

member.name: T:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock
member.summary: The class of an object representing a block of ip addresses. See https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Range_blocks.

member.name: P:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.CIDRSuffix
member.summary: The CIDR suffix determines the number of significant bits in the .

member.name: P:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.BlockAddress
member.summary: The block address which is the same as the first ip address in the block.

member.name: P:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.CIDRMaxSuffix
member.summary: The maximum length of the CIDR suffix.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.#ctor(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Constructs an object representing a block of ip addresses.
member.param: The suffix determines the number of significant bits of the block address.
member.exception: If the block format is incorrect.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.op_Implicit(System.Net.IPAddress)~Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock
member.summary: Allow implicit cast from IPAddress to IPAddressBlock for convenience.
member.param: The IPAddress to cast to an IPAddressBlock.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string representation of a block of ip addresses and creates a corresponding object.
member.param: The string representation of a block of ip addresses.
member.returns: An object representing a block of ip addresses.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.Contains(System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Determines if the passed ip address occurs in the CIDR range defined by this object.
member.returns: True if the ip address occurs in this range and false otherwise.
member.remarks:
As per https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Range_blocks - "Technical Explanation":
CIDR notation is written as the IP address, a slash, and the CIDR suffix (for example, the IPv4 "10.2.3.41/24" or IPv6 "a3:bc00::/24"). The CIDR suffix is the number of starting digits every IP address in the range have in common when written in binary.
For example: "10.10.1.32" is binary "00001010.00001010.00000001.00100000", so 10.10.1.32/27 will match the first 27 digits("00001010.00001010.00000001.00100000"). The IP addresses 10.10.1.32–10.10.1.63, when converted to binary, all have the same 27 first digits and will be blocked if 10.10.1.32 / 27 is blocked.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.IPAddressBlock.ToString
member.summary: Returns the block of ip addresses defined by this object as a string.
member.returns: The block of ip addresses defined by this object as a string.

member.summary: Returns a list of every address assigned to a particular account.
member.param: The name of the account containing the addresses to get. To get addresses from the default account, pass an empty string ("").
member.returns: A collection of all addresses belonging to the specified account. If the account has no addresses, the collection will be empty.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCClient.GetReceivedByAddress(Blockcore.NBitcoin.BitcoinAddress)
member.summary: Returns the total amount received by the specified address in transactions with at least one (default) confirmations. It does not count coinbase transactions.
member.param: The address whose transactions should be tallied.
member.returns: The number of bitcoins received by the address, excluding coinbase transactions. May be 0.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCClient.GetReceivedByAddress(Blockcore.NBitcoin.BitcoinAddress,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the total amount received by the specified address in transactions with the specified number of confirmations. It does not count coinbase transactions.
member.param: The minimum number of confirmations an externally-generated transaction must have before it is counted towards the balance. Transactions generated by this node are counted immediately. Typically, externally-generated transactions are payments to this wallet and transactions generated by this node are payments to other wallets. Use 0 to count unconfirmed transactions. Default is 1.
member.returns: The number of bitcoins received by the address, excluding coinbase transactions. May be 0.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCClient.ListAccounts
member.summary: Lists accounts and their balances, with the default number of confirmations for balances (1), and not including watch only addresses (default false).

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCClient.ListAccounts(System.Int32)
member.summary: Lists accounts and their balances, based on the specified number of confirmations.
member.param: The minimum number of confirmations an externally-generated transaction must have before it is counted towards the balance. Transactions generated by this node are counted immediately. Typically, externally-generated transactions are payments to this wallet and transactions generated by this node are payments to other wallets. Use 0 to count unconfirmed transactions. Default is 1.
member.returns: A list of accounts and their balances.

member.name: M:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCClient.ListAccounts(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Lists accounts and their balances, based on the specified number of confirmations, and including watch only accounts if specified. (Added in Bitcoin Core 0.10.0)
member.param: The minimum number of confirmations an externally-generated transaction must have before it is counted towards the balance. Transactions generated by this node are counted immediately. Typically, externally-generated transactions are payments to this wallet and transactions generated by this node are payments to other wallets. Use 0 to count unconfirmed transactions. Default is 1.

If set to true, include watch-only addresses in details and calculations as if they were regular addresses belonging to the wallet. If set to false (the default), treat watch-only addresses as if they didn’t belong to this wallet.
member.returns: A list of accounts and their balances.

member.summary: Returns an array of unspent transaction outputs belonging to this wallet.

remarks.para: Note: as of Bitcoin Core 0.10.0, outputs affecting watch-only addresses will be returned; see the spendable field in the results.

member.name: T:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode
member.summary: RPC error code thrown by the .

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_INVALID_REQUEST
member.summary: RPC_INVALID_REQUEST is internally mapped to HTTP_BAD_REQUEST (400). It should not be used for application-layer errors.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_METHOD_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: RPC_METHOD_NOT_FOUND is internally mapped to HTTP_NOT_FOUND (404). It should not be used for application-layer errors.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_INTERNAL_ERROR
member.summary: RPC_INTERNAL_ERROR should only be used for genuine errors in bitcoind (for example datadir corruption).

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_MISC_ERROR
member.summary: Exception thrown in command handling.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_FORBIDDEN_BY_SAFE_MODE
member.summary: Server is in safe mode, and command is not allowed in safe mode.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_TYPE_ERROR
member.summary: Unexpected type was passed as parameter.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY
member.summary: Invalid address or key.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_OUT_OF_MEMORY
member.summary: Ran out of memory during operation.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER
member.summary: Invalid, missing or duplicate parameter.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_DATABASE_ERROR
member.summary: Database error.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_DESERIALIZATION_ERROR
member.summary: Error parsing or validating structure in raw format.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_VERIFY_ERROR
member.summary: General error during transaction or block submission.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_VERIFY_REJECTED
member.summary: Transaction or block was rejected by network rules.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_VERIFY_ALREADY_IN_CHAIN
member.summary: Transaction already in chain.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_IN_WARMUP
member.summary: Client still warming up.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_METHOD_DEPRECATED
member.summary: RPC method is deprecated.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_CLIENT_NOT_CONNECTED
member.summary: Bitcoin is not connected.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_CLIENT_IN_INITIAL_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: Still downloading initial blocks.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_CLIENT_NODE_ALREADY_ADDED
member.summary: Node is already added.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_CLIENT_NODE_NOT_ADDED
member.summary: Node has not been added before.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_CLIENT_NODE_NOT_CONNECTED
member.summary: Node to disconnect not found in connected nodes.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_CLIENT_INVALID_IP_OR_SUBNET
member.summary: Invalid IP/Subnet.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_CLIENT_P2P_DISABLED
member.summary: No valid connection manager instance found.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_WALLET_ERROR
member.summary: Unspecified problem with wallet (key not found etc.).

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_WALLET_INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
member.summary: Not enough funds in wallet or account.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_WALLET_INVALID_ACCOUNT_NAME
member.summary: Invalid account name.

member.name: F:Blockcore.Features.RPC.RPCErrorCode.RPC_WALLET_KEYPOOL_RAN_OUT
member.summary: Keypool ran out, call keypoolrefill first.
